alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 30 at 9:28PM PST until December 31 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST SUNDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST SUNDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IS CANCELLED... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding. For the High Surf Advisory, breaking waves of 6 to 10 feet, except up to 15 feet near Point Conception, are expected tonight, subsiding to 4 to 8 feet on Sunday. Highest surf on southwest to west facing beaches. Strong rip currents. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast and Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 9 PM PST Sunday. For the High Surf Advisory, until 8 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of sea water is possible around the time of high tide, over vulnerable low-lying coastal areas. Significant damage to roads or structures is NOT expected. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A high tide of 5.7 feet is expected between 1100 AM to 1130 AM Sunday.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Do NOT drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast
